Ingredients:

  • 1 cup jasmine rice
  • 6 cups chicken broth
  • 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, peeled and minced
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 medium-sized onion, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • Fish sauce (patis), to taste
  • Ground black pepper, to taste

Toppings:

  • Fried garlic
  • Sliced green onions
  • Calamansi or lemon wedges
  • Hard-boiled eggs (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Rinse the jasmine rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Set aside.

  2. In a large pot, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Add the minced ginger, garlic, and onion. Saut√© until fragrant and the onion becomes translucent.

  3. Add the rinsed jasmine rice to the pot and stir well to coat the rice with the aromatic mixture.

  4. Pour in the chicken broth and bring it to a boil. Once boiling, lower the heat to a simmer and cover the pot. Let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and has broken down to thicken the porridge. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

  5. As the rice cooks, you can adjust the consistency of the lugaw by adding more chicken broth if you prefer a thinner porridge or less broth if you like it thicker.

  6. Season the lugaw with fish sauce (patis) and ground black pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning according to your preference.

  7. To serve, ladle the lugaw into bowls. Garnish each bowl with fried garlic, sliced green onions, and a squeeze of calamansi or lemon juice. You can also top it with hard-boiled eggs if desired.

  8. Serve the lugaw while it's still hot and enjoy its comforting flavors.

Lugaw is often enjoyed as a comforting breakfast or as a soothing dish during times of illness. It's a simple and nourishing rice porridge that is easy to make and can be customized with your preferred toppings.
